lead_paragraph: The first half of the season seemed part showcase for the Patriots’ new offensive threats and part puzzle: why would this team bother to cheat? The Patriots pulverized their opponents, winning games by pinball margins: 38-7, 34-13, 48-27 — against the Cowboys, the best the National Football Conference had to offer then — 52-7, 56-10. Only the Colts, their most talented opponent, gave the Patriots a game before falling, 24-20.
